verses.niv: 19 Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord,
verses.kjv: 19 Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;
verses.esv: 19 Repent therefore, and turn back, that your sins may be blotted out,

verses.niv: 17 From that time on Jesus began to preach, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near."
verses.kjv: 17 From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.esv: 17 From that time Jesus began to preach, saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”

verses.niv: 9 The Lord is not slow in keeping his promise, as some understand slowness. He is patient with you, not wanting anyone to perish, but everyone to come to repentance.
verses.kjv: 9 The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
verses.esv: 9 The Lord is not slow to fulfill his promise as some count slowness, but is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should reach repentance.

verses.niv: 38 Peter replied, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.kjv: 38 Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
verses.esv: 38 And Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.niv: 30 In the past God overlooked such ignorance, but now he commands all people everywhere to repent.
verses.kjv: 30 And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:
verses.esv: 30 The times of ignorance God overlooked, but now he commands all people everywhere to repent,

verses.niv: 4 Or do you show contempt for the riches of his kindness, tolerance and patience, not realizing that God's kindness leads you toward repentance?
verses.kjv: 4 Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?
verses.esv: 4 Or do you presume on the riches of his kindness and forbearance and patience, not knowing that God’s kindness is meant to lead you to repentance?

verses.niv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.
verses.kjv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.esv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

verses.niv: 8 Produce fruit in keeping with repentance.
verses.kjv: 8 Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:
verses.esv: 8 Bear fruit in keeping with repentance.

verses.niv: 14 if my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then will I hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and will heal their land.
verses.kjv: 14 If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
verses.esv: 14 if my people who are called by my name humble themselves, and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and heal their land.

verses.niv: 18 When they heard this, they had no further objections and praised God, saying, "So then, God has granted even the Gentiles repentance unto life."
verses.kjv: 18 When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.
verses.esv: 18 When they heard these things they fell silent. And they glorified God, saying, “Then to the Gentiles also God has granted repentance that leads to life.”

verses.niv: 3 I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.
verses.kjv: 3 I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
verses.esv: 3 No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.

verses.niv: 32 I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."
verses.kjv: 32 I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
verses.esv: 32 I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.”

verses.niv: 5 Remember the height from which you have fallen! Repent and do the things you did at first. If you do not repent, I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place.
verses.kjv: 5 Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen, and repent, and do the first works; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will remove thy candlestick out of his place, except thou repent.
verses.esv: 5 Remember therefore from where you have fallen; repent, and do the works you did at first. If not, I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place, unless you repent.

verses.niv: 13 He who conceals his sins does not prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy.
verses.kjv: 13 He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
verses.esv:
13   Whoever conceals his transgressions will not prosper,
    but he who confesses and forsakes them will obtain mercy.

verses.niv: 31 God exalted him to his own right hand as Prince and Savior that he might give repentance and forgiveness of sins to Israel.
verses.kjv: 31 Him hath God exalted with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
verses.esv: 31 God exalted him at his right hand as Leader and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.

verses.niv: 25 Those who oppose him he must gently instruct, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth,
verses.kjv: 25 In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;
verses.esv: 25 correcting his opponents with gentleness. God may perhaps grant them repentance leading to a knowledge of the truth,

verses.niv: 15 "The time has come," he said. "The kingdom of God is near. Repent and believe the good news!"
verses.kjv: 15 And saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.
verses.esv: 15 and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the gospel.”

verses.niv: 19 Those whom I love I rebuke and discipline. So be earnest, and repent.
verses.kjv: 19 As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.
verses.esv: 19 Those whom I love, I reprove and discipline, so be zealous and repent.

verses.niv: 7 I tell you that in the same way there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent.
verses.kjv: 7 I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.
verses.esv: 7 Just so, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.

verses.niv: 2 and saying, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near."
verses.kjv: 2 And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.esv: 2 “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”

verses.niv: 10 Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.
verses.kjv: 10 For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.
verses.esv: 10 For godly grief produces a repentance that leads to salvation without regret, whereas worldly grief produces death.

verses.niv: 15 This is what the Sovereign LORD, the Holy One of Israel, says: "In repentance and rest is your salvation, in quietness and trust is your strength, but you would have none of it.
verses.kjv: 15 For thus saith the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
verses.esv:
15   For thus said the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel,
  “In returning and rest you shall be saved;
    in quietness and in trust shall be your strength.”
  But you were unwilling,

verses.niv: 47 and repentance and forgiveness of sins will be preached in his name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.kjv: 47 And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.esv: 47 and that repentance for the forgiveness of sins should be proclaimed in his name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.

verses.niv: 20 First to those in Damascus, then to those in Jerusalem and in all Judea, and to the Gentiles also, I preached that they should repent and turn to God and prove their repentance by their deeds.
verses.kjv: 20 But shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judaea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.
verses.esv: 20 but declared first to those in Damascus, then in Jerusalem and throughout all the region of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, performing deeds in keeping with their repentance.

verses.niv: 21 I have declared to both Jews and Greeks that they must turn to God in repentance and have faith in our Lord Jesus.
verses.kjv: 21 Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.esv: 21 testifying both to Jews and to Greeks of repentance toward God and of faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.
